name: Sediment deposition patterns
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Deposition matches natural form, no severe bar formation beyond typical references.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate bar types (point, mid-channel, lateral) and compare to expected morphology for the channel type.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Deposition pattern fits reference condition with stable point bars.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Some mid-channel or side bars forming but not severely altering flow.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Extensive mid-channel bars with partial obstruction.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Widespread choking deposits that strongly affect channel form and habitat.
